data.title: Mitsui Iron Ore (Rio Tinto Operations) - Mitsui & Co. (Australia) Ltd.
data.meta_site_name: Mitsui Iron Ore (Rio Tinto Operations) - Mitsui & Co. (Australia) Ltd.
data.text:
Robe River Joint Venture

Robe River is a joint venture between Rio Tinto (53%), Mitsui Iron Ore Development (33%), and Nippon Steel Australia Pty. Ltd. (14%). Operations began in the Robe Valley in 1972 followed by expansion at West Angelas in 2002. Today, Robe River produces approximately 65 million tons per annum of iron ore, which is railed to the port of Cape Lambert where lump and fines product is shipped to steel producers, primarily throughout Asia.

Corporate Social Responsibility

Since 2013 we have partnered with Scitech to support the delivery of a robotics education program within Pilbara primary schools. We also support various other organisations such as Cancer Council WA, West Australian Ballet and the Royal Flying Doctors Service.
